page.title: 11POLEGATE RESIDENT/INTERVIEW
page.content: MR. TWINE HAS LIVED IN POLEGATE FOR 60 YEARS. HE ORIGINALLY CAME TO START A BUS BUSINESS. HE FEELS THAT THE ROADS HAVE CHANGED BUT LOCAL BUSINESSES HAVE CHANGED THE MOST. HE NOW USES A CAR FOR HIS TRANSPORT. MR. TWINE WOULD LIKE TO SEE EASTBOURNE AND POLEGATE MORE SEPARATE.HE WORKED IN POLEGATE WHICH WAS THEN A SMALL PLACE. THE ORIGINAL TRANSPORT WAS THE RAILWAY.HE ATTENDS A LOT OF POLEGATE CLUBS. HE SAID PEOPLE WOULD LIKE TO LIVE IN POLEGATE BECAUSE IT'S NICELY SITUATED AND NEAR EASTBOURNE AND ITS FACILITIES.PEOPLE WOULD MAINLY COME TO POLEGATE TO VISIT RELATIVES. HE SAID HE LIKED MOST OF THE DAY TO DAY SHOPS. ALTHOUGH HE DOES NOT LIKE TECHNOLOGY PARTICULARLY, HE DOES HAVE A TELEVISION,A MUSIC CENTRE,AN ALARM CLOCK,SOME CALCULATORS,A WASHING MACHINE AND A SPINDRIER.
